content:
Triage meeting time!
@WG-async-foundations
I didn't have a lot new for the agenda this week, mostly just standing issues

• Announcements
    - (add items)
  • [nikomatsakis] Update on [vision] doc
  • [eholk] New issue [triage]
  • (add items)
For announcements, the first async working group sprint is going until Thursday. Most of the goals seem to be planning for this one, but some implementation work is happening too.
@Gus Wynn seems to be making good progress on the #[must_not_suspend] lint, which is exciting!
Does anyone have any additional announcements?
(none here just now)
If not, we can move on
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Next on the agenda is "Update on vision doc"
@nikomatsakis - is there anything new to share here?
Not really
I have one update
Okay
There are some pending PRs and i had planned to do more refinement of mine
or signal boost, really
for goal initiatives and owners, I made issue templates to track getting those set up
Oh, thanks for the reminder! I'll try to get mine set up today
I've been finding it helpful to have a checklist in my own areas :)
For sure :)
One other thing is
it's not so much an announcement but
as I was working on https://github.com/rust-lang/wg-async-foundations/pull/230
which is the PR I was referring to, that I want to return to
it tries to create those meta narratives
I've been working on the one I know best, which is like "people building a service"
but I am going to want some help trying to dive a bit deeper into other use cases and what the experience is like
e.g. embedded comes to mind
so if people are interested in that, let me know
I'm hoping to put in more time and finish that up this week to serve as a better example
the PR also has some interesting things in it I'd like feedback on
for example:
the major problems we see today
and I've created some summaries
that's all :)
Awesome, this looks good so far! I'll try to look over this some more too (I feel like I've been saying that for three weeks now though...)
yeah, I've been saying I'll do more writing for a few weeks too :)

Okay, is there anything else here? Otherwise we can move on to new issue triage.
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
the PR is a little large so it's hard to review all of it at once
maybe breaking it up would help?
@tmandry that seems reasonable
For new issue triage, it looks like there are no new issues
for this particular sprint, we didn't really pick up polish issues, right?
or if I did I forget what I volunteered for
but I'm thinking about whether to try and pick one off :)
yeah we decided to make it optional
Yeah, we didn't officially assign anything, but fixes are still welcome :)
but encouraged :)
I've been looking through the issues in the project board and other open async issues so I can give better advice for the next sprint
I'm focusing on trying to get planning and organizational stuff out of the way first in this sprint
We do have a couple issues in the In-Progress column that either seemed to have someone actively working on them, or were pretty close to getting finished
Have you had time @eholk to work more on the liveness-based stuff you've been doing?
(after that I have a backlog of 1-2 issues I wanted to revisit)
Yeah, I'm making progress on the liveness stuff
It's going slower than I'd hoped. Temporaries are turning out to be kind of tricky. I have some hacks that sort of do it, so now I need to refine those
hmm
let me know if you want to chat over the details at some point
Basically I'm using ExprUseVisitor to find borrowed values, and also just counting the result of every expression as a temporary for liveness sake
why do you have to do both?
The thing that surprised me was expressions have a type T, but if they are borrowed we actually want to track them as type &T or &mut T
anyway, we should prob discuss offline, but that sounds like an overapprox?
I'm not sure I do
Yeah, let's chat some more about this
Using all the expression results doesn't seem to change much, it just means liveness has a lot more things to track, but the lifetimes are usually very short.
Anyway, I think that's everything on the agenda.
Does anything else have anything to bring up?

(sorry I was late) must_not_suspend seems to just have a few more pieces of review

one outstanding problem is that I couldn't get it to work annotated on fn's, but it still covers the most pertinent cases (https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/187312-wg-async-foundations/topic/must_not_suspend.20annotations.20on.20fn's has more info, im pretty sure the fn return case is really complicated)
(there is also another FIXME in the pr that seems to be inconsequential)
*pieces of review I need to work through, just some refactoring
Awesome!
the basic "annotate a mutex guard" or "annotate tracing::EnteredSpan" (apparently they really want this) should work
great. that's definitely the most important use case I had in mind
I'm excited by the progress here :)
Okay, great! Well, thanks everyone for tuning in. I'll go ahead and end the meeting, but feel free to hang out and chat if there's anything else.
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
Thanks all!
